descriptions: Lesson 1 • Talking About a New Project
lessonTitle: Lesson 1 • Talking About a New Project
lessonDescription: Carl, Greg, and Anne work for WaterSonic Corporation. Recently, the company has come up with an idea for a new electric toothbrush.

paragraphs.speaker: Carl:
paragraphs.text: I think we've come up with a winner.

paragraphs.speaker: Anne:
paragraphs.text: I agree. The new Brush-o-matic should be a blockbuster!

paragraphs.speaker: Carl:
paragraphs.text: Our designers have already made up some prototypes. The toothbrushes have a tooth-whitening attachment and many other bells and whistles.

paragraphs.speaker: Greg:
paragraphs.text: We should fast track this project. Let's try to launch it in time for the holiday season.

paragraphs.speaker: Anne:
paragraphs.text: This will be a great stocking stuffer!

paragraphs.speaker: Carl:
paragraphs.text: We definitely need a big win for the holidays.

paragraphs.speaker: Anne:
paragraphs.text: This is a great idea. We're going to make a killing.

paragraphs.speaker: Greg:
paragraphs.text: Let's not talk about this project to anybody who doesn't need to know. We'll keep it under wraps.

paragraphs.speaker: Carl:
paragraphs.text: I agree. Mum's the word. We don't want any of our competitors to get wind of the idea and rip it off.

paragraphs.speaker: Anne:
paragraphs.text: Right. Let's meet again on Monday morning and discuss our game plan for getting this project off the ground!

radioExercises.title: Choose the best substitute for the phrase or sentence in bold.
radioExercises.question: 1. Did the company think of this new produxt idea themselves? No, they ripped it off from an inventor.

options.label: a) No, they paid an inventor for the idea.
b) No, they stole the idea from an inventor
c) No, they discussed it with an inventor and he agreed to sell it to them.

radioExercises.question: 2. Jill is planning to quit her job at the end of September, but mum's the word.

options.label: a) don't tell anybody
b) don't tell her mother
c) she may change her mind

radioExercises.question: 3. Sony has made a killing on its popular PlayStation line.

options.label: a) lost money on
b) made a lot of money on
c) decided to stop producing

radioExercises.question: 4. After receiving a large loan from the bank, the company was finally able to get its project off the ground.

options.label: a) get started on the project
b) cancel the project
c) borrow money

radioExercises.question: 5. That new software company seems very disorganized. Do they have a game plan?

options.label: a) plan for closing down their business
b) plan for developing new games
c) plan for how they will proceed to grow their business

radioExercises.question: 6. Some experts recommend that when you're interviewing for a new job, you should keep your current salary under wraps.

options.label: a) you should tell the interviewer what your current salary is
b) you should say you're making twice as much as you're really earning
c) you should not say how much you're currently earning

radioExercises.question: 7. Don's new cell phone has a video camera and all sorts of other bells and whistles.

options.label: a) fancy features
b) things that make loud ringing noises and whistle tones
c) features typical in a low-priced product

radioExercises.question: 8. When investors got wind of the fact that the pharmaceutical company's major drug increased the risk of heart attacks, the company's stock price fell.

options.label: a) hid
b) discovered
c) got fed up with
